subject: Re: [junit] Re: Testing Private Methods
msgSnippet: ... To me Mike, you re coming across as rude. Someone saying they re too busy to write an article right now is perfectly good reason - no-one here has to
messageBody:
Mike Colbert wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:

>>At this point, I feel that you are being unnecessarily antagonistic.
>>Rudeness objection. Please tone it down.
>>
>
> Oh, but it's my approach that was attacked with a groundless claim.
> Sorry for wondering why.
>
>>am asking you to tone it down. Just because we do not write
>>novel-length, in-depth answers to your question does not mean that
>
> we
>
>>are evading anything. It means that we are busy.
>>
>
> HAHAHAHAHAHA!! You guys are too much ...

To me Mike, you're coming across as rude. Someone saying they're too
busy to write an article right now is perfectly good reason - no-one
here has to answer your questions in your timeframe. Yet, I haven't
seen any explanation as to what is inferior in your approach -
asserting it's inferior does not make it so. I also found the waving
of the moderator stick distasteful; it's far too early for that.

A suggestion - stop posting for 24 hours on this thread, then come
back to it.

Bill de hÓra
